intro: Orthocarpus rarior, commonly known as the rare orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white or greenish flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
